page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF LANDRAKE
page.content: Landrake is an old village that grew up around the church.Today the village is cut into two parts by the A38 trunk road.All the amenities are on the southern side-the{church,chapel,}pub, {shops}and{school.}It used to have many shops but since the building of the Tamar Road Bridge in 1962 and better roads,most people shop in nearby Saltash or Plymouth. The 1980's saw the building of the Highertown housing estate in Landrake. This enabled new families to move into the village,many of whom work in Plymouth. Twenty years ago,the majority of working adults of Landrake were employed on the farms or quarries in the area,but today,Landrake is another dormitory village.
